They had been cooked within the last 30 minutes so they were kept and heated back up to above 135 degrees in lieu of discarding. The product that was on top was at 135 but just a few pieces below the temperature had dropped to below 135. Product was spread out so the heat source from above was evenly distributed. Chicken must not be piled in this holding unit. Train staff to know they must spread the product out so the heat source is distributed across all pieces. Do not pile the chicken. Monitor closely to ensure the product holds at or above 135 degrees.
